content.question: Which of the following areas shows the consumer surplus?

choices.label: <math alttext="A, P sub 0, end sub, E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A, P sub 1, end sub, B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>B</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P sub 0, end sub, F, E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mtext>E</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="A, P sub 1, end sub, B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>B</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
